Posts.Content: Yes, BRCA positive. I have the cancer gene that will attack my ovaries next. Since I am 39 and already have 2 boys, I am ok with them taking out my ovaries. I have rather large breasts and I am a little worried about the mastectomy. I am ok with not having them, just not sure how I will handle the huge adjustment. time will tell.
Posts.Title: help - what to do if i get a cold during chemo?

Posts.Content: I am glad you posted this question. I have a treatment next week, and I got a case of coughing, sore throat and hurting in chest from a co-worker. (If you are sick, stay home!) I called the doctor and they are calling me in some antibiotics to treat it before it becomes an infection. I felt at ease after reading all the replies to your original post. This "journey" that we are all going through is not as scary when I know there are people out there that can relate and offer advice. Thank you all very much! I have learned a lot from this blog.
Posts.Title: help - what to do if i get a cold during chemo?

Posts.Content: I take the Oxycenton and Texerone. (maybe misspelled I don't have my folder in front of me). I take it every 3 weeks. I have 1 more treatment to go!!!!  I have stage IIA breast cancer, we did a lumpectomy, it had not spread to my lymphnodes (thankful). I am fighting and I am winning!!! I will soon have a hysterectomy, and later on a full mastectomy.
Posts.Title: help - what to do if i get a cold during chemo?

Posts.Content: You are absolutely correct, I just got off the phone with my dr. I had blood work yesterday, so he looked over results and called me in a prescription. Thanks for your post.
Posts.Title: help - what to do if i get a cold during chemo?
